Job Description
Job Family Summary

The UBI APL Data Team is responsible for collaborating with clients to enable them to make objective customer-focused decisions by providing analytical insight and ensuring trusted actionable data. The team is responsible for analytics, as well as serving in a consultant role to teams across Product Operations providing ad hoc requests, implementation metrics, performance scorecards and other analytic visualization reporting.
Job Summary

A Product Intelligence Sr Consultant II will be responsible for collaborating with clients to enable them with trusted actionable data to break down business problems into solvable components by assessing the requirements and/or business implications to arrive at recommended solutions. They will serve in a consultant role to teams across Product Operations providing leadership to produce actionable results in the form of ad hoc requests, implementation metrics, performance scorecards and other analytic visualization reporting along with insights about the business or data.
Key Responsibilities
  • Lead projects requested by Senior Leadership to provide support for speed to market, vital, company decisions
  • Gather requirements/understand purpose of request
  • Lead and provide complex data extraction and analytical support for a variety of internal customers and external recipients
  • Analytical support includes inspecting and cleaning data to provide useful information and to suggest conclusions to the client for decision making.
  • Support the needs of modeling and analytics by delivering data based on client requirements. Utilize an array of data sources, all in different forms and with different tools or methods to create a solution
  • Design and create reporting with limited assistance so that business users may visually understand and explore a new product feature or functionality before implementation to expose design assumptions and drive ideation
  • Design and create reporting so that key measurements are in place with implementation of products
  • Lead User Acceptance Testing and develop test plans and scripts, prepare test data, reconcile data sources and execute functional tests
  • Works with data stewards in the testing/profiling of data and validation of newly captured data to ensure proper operation and accuracy
  • Troubleshoots data quality issues - identifying root cause/system & documentation/communication of resolution
  • Serve as a mentor to team members
Job Qualifications
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Experience
  • Bachelors or Masters/MBA majoring in a quantitative field such as Math, Business or Computer Science
  • 3-5 years of related experience
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Strong experience in time and task management
  • Strong attention to details
  • Intermediate Microsoft Office skills
  • Advanced technology fluency in tools and software/programming languages with key analytic applications (SAS, MySQL, PL/SQL, Oracle, UNIX, OLAP, Tableau)
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary groups and all organizational levels.
  • Intermediate presentation skills

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
